<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/hm-nike-face-backlash-china-calling-xinjiang-labor-concerns?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Chinese Shoppers Try to Return H&M
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/hm-nike-face-backlash-china-calling-xinjiang-labor-concerns" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a dark rain cloud hovering over the red H&M logo in front of a pale purple background." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTA0L2hfbS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your guidance counselor wasn’t kidding when they said everything you post online can come back to haunt you. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Ex.: </strong>Last September, H&M released a statement saying it was concerned about allegations of forced labor in Xinjiang, a Chinese territory that produces an estimated 20% of the world’s cotton. This week, that statement <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/25/981113024/china-retaliates-against-clothing-brands-after-western-sanctions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got attention</a> from internet users in China, who joined state officials and businesses there in making this a week from hell for H&M.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Popular Chinese e-commerce platforms <a href="https://apnews.com/article/china-boycott-hm-over-xinjiang-9e9a27b7179bd7a34330b8325ac37cdb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled</a> H&M products. State media outlets called out other apparel brands, including Nike and Adidas, that've made statements about boycotting Xinjiang cotton. And celebrities including Wang Yibo and Victoria Song are dropping H&M and/or Nike endorsements. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Beijing helped fuel consumer anger using social media. On the Weibo app, users are </span><span><a href="https://www.insider.com/chinese-weibo-angry-xinjiang-burning-nike-shoes-2021-3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posting videos</a></span><span> of their burning Nike kicks.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>There's a lot at stake for H&M. China is its third-largest market and in 2019 accounted for 500+ stores and $1.4 billion in sales.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Retailers aren't alone figuring this out</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Businesses across industries <a href="https://qz.com/1988896/under-pressure-in-china-zara-deleted-a-statement-about-xinjiang/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walk a careful line</a> to stay on Beijing's nice list and get access to its massive consumer market. Calls to support pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong rocked the boat in 2019, but Xinjiang may prove a harder issue to dodge. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China is accused of detaining an estimated 1–2 million members of Muslim ethnic minorities and subjecting them to torture, forced labor, sterilization, and more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US, Canadian, and Dutch governments recently labeled what’s happening as genocide. And this week, the US, Britain, Canada, and the EU sanctioned Chinese officials with links to Xinjiang abuses. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">An emerging business case study </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In light of Xinjiang, calls are growing to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/24/inside-growing-calls-boycott-2022-beijing-winter-olympics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boycott the 2022 Beijing Olympics</a>. Some of the games' top sponsors—which include Airbnb, Visa, Coca-Cola, and P&G—are already fielding questions.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Tuesday, a human rights group coalition sent a letter to Airbnb asking it to pull out, questioning the company's commitment to "social responsibility." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As they weigh commenting on the situation in Xinjiang, execs are surely watching what happens to these apparel brands and considering their options.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/massive-container-ship-ever-given-still-stuck-suez-canal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
"Like An Enormous Beached Whale"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/massive-container-ship-ever-given-still-stuck-suez-canal" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ever Given ship" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDk5L2V2ZXJfZ2l2ZW5fc2hpcC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Suez Canal Authority/HO/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The chief executive of a Dutch company trying to free the 220,000-ton container ship that's currently stuck in the Suez Canal said it <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-suezcanal-ship/ship-blocking-suez-canal-like-beached-whale-could-be-stuck-for-weeks-idUSKBN2BH0BA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could take</a> days, if not weeks, to unstuck it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Describing the ship's "enormous weight on the sand," Boskalis CEO Peter Berdowski said workers might need to try a combo of dredging the sand and unloading the ship, called the Ever Given, to get it floating again. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is the worst marine traffic jam since Crush got a flat fin on the East Australian Current. About 185 cargo ships carrying billions of dollars in goods—from livestock to crude oil—are waiting to enter the waterway.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The situation for global trade is so dire that two of the largest ocean shipping companies in the world are considering <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-25/big-container-lines-consider-diverting-ships-around-africa?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rerouting ships</a> around the Horn of Africa to get their cargo to its destinations. But that's like driving from New York to Philadelphia via Calgary: It adds 6,000 miles and $300,000 in fuel costs to the journey. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/darden-restaurants-raising-wages-sign-sales?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When You're Here, You're Making More Money
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/darden-restaurants-raising-wages-sign-sales" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Olive Garden breadsticks in front of a waving American flag" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/pKzAHJQlKqwiQ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Olive Garden breadsticks in front of a waving American flag" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/pKzAHJQlKqwiQ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Darden Restaurants, the parent company of Olive Garden, said hourly workers will make at least <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/olive-garden-parent-to-boost-wages-as-sales-pick-up-11616683909?mod=hp_lista_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$10/hour</a> in wages + tips combined starting Monday. It will also give $17 million in one-time employee bonuses.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Though a proposed $15 federal minimum wage was scrapped from the last Covid relief bill, other companies like Amazon and Costco have set minimum wages of at least $15 and encouraged other retailers to follow.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Darden isn’t just trying to outshine Bezos and…Mr. Costco (?): The restaurant business is starting to look better. The CEO of Darden, which also owns LongHorn Steakhouse, said he was “<a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-ee361ee5e6bcbb4ff40f3b7de2b5c7d9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cautiously optimistic</a>” about the future of sit-down dining.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Then vs. now. </strong>Covid did a number on restaurants, specifically those that make their money off of middle school soccer team banquets. At one point during the pandemic, same-store sales at Darden restaurants dropped 75%. But last week, same-store sales topped levels from the same week in 2019 by 5.4%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Darden’s positive outlook could point to the beginning of a restaurant industry recovery, and signal you’re one step closer to getting back into a big leather booth.</p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators

<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The full Epic Pass, which grants access to dozens of Vail ski resorts across the world, costs $783 for the 2021-22 ski season—a <a href="https://www.travelandleisure.com/trip-ideas/skiing-trips/vail-resorts-epic-pass-price-reduction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20% reduction</a> from years past. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"You don't really believe the peeing in bottles thing, do you?"</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This was how the Amazon News Twitter account <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/25/22350337/amazon-peeing-in-bottles-workers-exploitation-twitter-response-evidence?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">replied to accusations</a> from US Rep. Mark Pocan that company employees were forced to urinate in water bottles because work quotas were so demanding. Amazon's labor practices are in the DC spotlight as workers at an Alabama warehouse vote on whether to unionize. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The geopolitical fight to come over green energy. (<a href="https://engelsbergideas.com/essays/the-geopolitical-fight-to-come-over-green-energy/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosfutureofwork&stream=future&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Engelsberg Ideas</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CURRENCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/bank-england-reveals-new-50-banknote-honoring-alan-turing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bank of England Honors One of the Coolest People Ever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The new 50-pound banknote featuring Alan Turing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTAzL25ld19ib2ZlX2Jhbmtub3RlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Bank of England</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Bank of England <a href="https://apnews.com/article/alan-turing-50-pound-bank-note-uk-codebreaker-d965076529b70fc8dbb020d364d88176?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> the design for its new £50 banknote featuring legendary codebreaker Alan Turing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Missed </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>The Imitation Game</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">?</strong> Turing was a computer scientist and mathematician who helped <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/25/22349884/alan-turing-50-pound-note-design-uk-revealed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crack the Nazis' Enigma code</a> during WWII, and is therefore credited with helping bring the war to a close.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In his work solving Enigma, he came up with the "Turing bombe," a precursor to the modern computer. He also developed the "Turing Test," which measures artificial intelligence. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After the war, Turing was persecuted by the UK government for his homosexuality. The government apologized for its treatment of him in 2009, and in 2013, Turing was royally pardoned. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The banknote includes an image of Turing, one of his quotes, and lots of nerdy Easter eggs such as a string of ticker tape displaying Turing's birthday in binary code. There's even a set of 12 puzzles, together called <a href="https://www.gchq.gov.uk/information/turing-challenge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Turing Challenge</a>, baked into the design. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the notes will enter circulation on June 23, Turing's birthday. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</h3>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Friday:</strong> Bjorn Steinbekk flew a drone <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CMr3605Avt-/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over lava</a> in Iceland, Hamza Gulzar baked up an oddly satisfying <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@boybawarchi/video/6927002019592948997?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESMgow8g8Zhq1FJpgZ7LuD7t4LTG5Wn80biYYwj4Kr9KD4UIFRctl%2FY%2FuU%2FzTJ6kTfYFemGgA%3D&language=en&preview_pb=0&sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAAZGwuPx35B4W7dDHNy6qslnq4-zQHrBWpsBePXOtoabdIBIh_iuMO7Mx91cSXuErd&share_item_id=6927002019592948997&share_link_id=0326947A-14F7-421F-B96B-79FEA41AE10B&timestamp=1616381556&tt_from=copy&u_code=dg3idibfcf7hmc&user_id=6906735666899469318&utm_campaign=client_share&utm_medium=ios&utm_source=copy&source=h5_m&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lemon tart</a>, and KarenBritChick has the best <a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9iJYHxY6IydTklWFTVZMLVKPD5T1kZOR&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Street Style</a> series. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best Biden impression: </strong>Dana Carvey of <em>SNL</em> fame <a href="https://twitter.com/ccadelago/status/1374784469664739330?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is the GOAT</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend baking rec: </strong>Rachel Cantor, the writer of our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/sidekick?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sidekick newsletter</a>, is obsessed with this pillowy <a href="https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/perfectly-pillowy-cinnamon-rolls-recipe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cinnamon roll recipe</a>. </p>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour guidance counselor wasn’t kidding when they said everything you post online can come back to haunt you. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEx.: \u003c/strong\u003eLast September, H\u0026M released a statement saying it was concerned about allegations of forced labor in Xinjiang, a Chinese territory that produces an estimated 20% of the world’s cotton. This week, that statement \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/03/25/981113024/china-retaliates-against-clothing-brands-after-western-sanctions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot attention\u003c/a\u003e from internet users in China, who joined state officials and businesses there in making this a week from hell for H\u0026M.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePopular Chinese e-commerce platforms \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/china-boycott-hm-over-xinjiang-9e9a27b7179bd7a34330b8325ac37cdb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled\u003c/a\u003e H\u0026M products. State media outlets called out other apparel brands, including Nike and Adidas, that've made statements about boycotting Xinjiang cotton. And celebrities including Wang Yibo and Victoria Song are dropping H\u0026M and/or Nike endorsements. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBeijing helped fuel consumer anger using social media. On the Weibo app, users are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.insider.com/chinese-weibo-angry-xinjiang-burning-nike-shoes-2021-3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposting videos\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of their burning Nike kicks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThere's a lot at stake for H\u0026M. China is its third-largest market and in 2019 accounted for 500+ stores and $1.4 billion in sales.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRetailers aren't alone figuring this out\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBusinesses across industries \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1988896/under-pressure-in-china-zara-deleted-a-statement-about-xinjiang/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalk a careful line\u003c/a\u003e to stay on Beijing's nice list and get access to its massive consumer market. Calls to support pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong rocked the boat in 2019, but Xinjiang may prove a harder issue to dodge. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina is accused of detaining an estimated 1–2 million members of Muslim ethnic minorities and subjecting them to torture, forced labor, sterilization, and more. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US, Canadian, and Dutch governments recently labeled what’s happening as genocide. And this week, the US, Britain, Canada, and the EU sanctioned Chinese officials with links to Xinjiang abuses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAn emerging business case study \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn light of Xinjiang, calls are growing to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/24/inside-growing-calls-boycott-2022-beijing-winter-olympics?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboycott the 2022 Beijing Olympics\u003c/a\u003e. Some of the games' top sponsors—which include Airbnb, Visa, Coca-Cola, and P\u0026G—are already fielding questions.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Tuesday, a human rights group coalition sent a letter to Airbnb asking it to pull out, questioning the company's commitment to \"social responsibility.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs they weigh commenting on the situation in Xinjiang, execs are surely watching what happens to these apparel brands and considering their options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe chief executive of a Dutch company trying to free the 220,000-ton container ship that's currently stuck in the Suez Canal said it \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-suezcanal-ship/ship-blocking-suez-canal-like-beached-whale-could-be-stuck-for-weeks-idUSKBN2BH0BA?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould take\u003c/a\u003e days, if not weeks, to unstuck it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDescribing the ship's \"enormous weight on the sand,\" Boskalis CEO Peter Berdowski said workers might need to try a combo of dredging the sand and unloading the ship, called the Ever Given, to get it floating again. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is the worst marine traffic jam since Crush got a flat fin on the East Australian Current. About 185 cargo ships carrying billions of dollars in goods—from livestock to crude oil—are waiting to enter the waterway.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe situation for global trade is so dire that two of the largest ocean shipping companies in the world are considering \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-25/big-container-lines-consider-diverting-ships-around-africa?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ererouting ships\u003c/a\u003e around the Horn of Africa to get their cargo to its destinations. But that's like driving from New York to Philadelphia via Calgary: It adds 6,000 miles and $300,000 in fuel costs to the journey. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDarden Restaurants, the parent company of Olive Garden, said hourly workers will make at least \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/olive-garden-parent-to-boost-wages-as-sales-pick-up-11616683909?mod=hp_lista_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$10/hour\u003c/a\u003e in wages + tips combined starting Monday. It will also give $17 million in one-time employee bonuses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThough a proposed $15 federal minimum wage was scrapped from the last Covid relief bill, other companies like Amazon and Costco have set minimum wages of at least $15 and encouraged other retailers to follow.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDarden isn’t just trying to outshine Bezos and…Mr. Costco (?): The restaurant business is starting to look better. The CEO of Darden, which also owns LongHorn Steakhouse, said he was “\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-ee361ee5e6bcbb4ff40f3b7de2b5c7d9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecautiously optimistic\u003c/a\u003e” about the future of sit-down dining.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThen vs. now. \u003c/strong\u003eCovid did a number on restaurants, specifically those that make their money off of middle school soccer team banquets. At one point during the pandemic, same-store sales at Darden restaurants dropped 75%. But last week, same-store sales topped levels from the same week in 2019 by 5.4%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDarden’s positive outlook could point to the beginning of a restaurant industry recovery, and signal you’re one step closer to getting back style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBank of England\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Bank of England \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/alan-turing-50-pound-bank-note-uk-codebreaker-d965076529b70fc8dbb020d364d88176?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e the design for its new £50 banknote featuring legendary codebreaker Alan Turing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMissed \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Imitation Game\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e?\u003c/strong\u003e Turing was a computer scientist and mathematician who helped \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/3/25/22349884/alan-turing-50-pound-note-design-uk-revealed?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrack the Nazis' Enigma code\u003c/a\u003e during WWII, and is therefore credited with helping bring the war to a close.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn his work solving Enigma, he came up with the \"Turing bombe,\" a precursor to the modern computer. He also developed the \"Turing Test,\" which measures artificial intelligence. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter the war, Turing was persecuted by the UK government for his homosexuality. The government apologized for its treatment of him in 2009, and in 2013, Turing was royally pardoned. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe banknote includes an image of Turing, one of his quotes, and lots of nerdy Easter eggs such as a string of ticker tape displaying Turing's birthday in binary code. There's even a set of 12 puzzles, together called \u003ca href=\"https://www.gchq.gov.uk/information/turing-challenge?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Turing Challenge\u003c/a\u003e, baked into the design. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe notes will enter circulation on June 23, Turing's
